desc.p: Allow postgresql to use ssh and rsync for point-in-time recovery
Allow unprivileged users to execute DDL statement
Allow transmit client label to foreign database
Allow database admins to execute DML statement

module.name: ssh
module.summary: Secure shell client and server policy.

desc.p: This template creates a derived domains which are used for ssh client sessions. A derived type is also created to protect the user ssh keys.
This template was added for NX.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

param.name: user_role
param.summary: The role associated with the user domain.

template.name: ssh_dyntransition_domain_template
template.summary: The template to define a domain to which sshd dyntransition.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The prefix of the dyntransition domain

template.name: ssh_server_template
template.summary: The template to define a ssh server.

desc.p: This template creates a domains to be used for creating a ssh server. This is typically done to have multiple ssh servers of different sensitivities, such as for an internal network-facing ssh server, and a external network-facing ssh server.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the server domain (e.g., sshd is the prefix for sshd_t).

param.name: role_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the role (e.g., user is the prefix for user_r).

Allow ssh logins as sysadm_r:sysadm_t
Allow ssh with chroot env to read and write files in the user home directories

interface.name: xserver_xsession_spec_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute an X session in the target domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

desc.p: Execute an Xsession in the target domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the shell process.

desc.p: Allows clients to write to the X server shared memory segments.
Allows XServer to execute writable memory
Allow the graphical login program to execute bootloader
Allow the graphical login program to login directly as sysadm_r:sysadm_t
Allow the graphical login program to create files in HOME dirs as xdm_home_t.
Support X userspace object manager
Allow regular users direct dri device access
